Comments_List: I gained a better understanding of how to approach beginning to code in MatLab based on how I would like to process and analyze my data

Strengths are the organization of the course, the breadth of analysis methods covered, and the in class demonstrations of programming.

Weaknesses are the occasionally large differences between assumed baseline knowledge in lectures and the occasional lack of in class coding demonstrations

Strengths: for different topics, different expertise are invited to give the lecture. It is a good class to combine the Matlab and neuroscience.

Weakness: the duration of the class is a little bit long, which may make it hard for students to focus on the lecture all the time. Perhaps divide one lecture into two each week. It is also a little hard for students who are not familiar with Matlab to catch the point in some advanced lectures. So maybe add more sessions about basic Matlab stills might be helpful.

Yes for those with some baseline experience in MatLab programming.  I would recommend doing an online course in MatLab code first for those with zero experience, or tell them to plan on spending at least 10 hours per week or more on class assignments

I would recommend the course to someone who has already had some fundamental skills about Matlab, cuz the class goes through everything very quickly, it is a little hard for students who are not familiar with Matlab to catch the idea in the later advanced lectures.
